item.description:
Event Four Mile River, Old Lyme, CT
June 30, 2007
10:00am in the water
Rating Novice / Intermediate
Description Coastal paddle with rocky area and islands.
Location:

Oakridge Drive
Old Lyme, Connecticut

Fees
None

Directions
From the East: Take I-95 South to exit 71. Turn left onto Four Mile River Road, follow for 1.0 mile. Four Mile River Road becomes Route 156/Shore Road. After approximately 0.5 miles turn left onto Oakridge Drive (into the Ridgewood neighborhood). Turn right into the parking lot of Four Mile River State Boat Launch.

From the West: Take I-95 North to exit 71. Turn left onto Four Mile River Road, follow for 0.8 miles. Four Mile River Road becomes Route 156/Shore Road. After approximately 0.5 miles turn left onto Oakridge Drive (into the Ridgewood neighborhood). Turn right into the parking lot of Four Mile River State Boat Launch.


Conyakers..Ok some of these guys are pretty nice (like me of course) and understanding..but some are just plain ass*****..
Even though they are right, its their method of interpersonal skills that are very much lacking..its only a few so its not the whole bunch...and the rest are very nice people..
They go at a pretty good pace...(its pretty easy with their kind of kayaks)...so for novices there is usually a slower pace group..but not always sure..

Their requirement;

They would like you to have sea kayaks, ok i can understand that, spray skirts, ok i use mine except for lakes and slow rivers, on the ocean, yes,
a PFD..oh they will act like they have a BFD if you dont have one of them..sometimes i just say i dont have mine or dont need it to see which one is the first snoty attitude...a real genuine pleasant concern is acknowledged with the truth that i have it in the boat ....in this area of the ocean..yes wear it..
some rescure skills..wet exit, paddlefloat..T , etc...

Now i only have spray skirts for the 3 ocean kayaks i have and you dont need one for the Cobra Expidition...
I have 4 PFD's 2 ok ones and 2 cheipie ones..they work ok anyway..

so i only have equipmet for 4...
If it seems like any one of the conyakers are snotty about anything...and i mean anything...
we will break off from them and do our own stuff, i dont need someone with an attitude of anything other than pleasant interferring with my reality...

so with that said, if the area looks like there are too many people or there is a snot in the conyakers..there is a even greater place to paddle just down the road...or we waite till they clear out and enjoy the water ourselves....
